law.catch_line: Bridges must be on primary roads.
law.text:
No contract shall be made for the purchase or construction of any bridge or part of a bridge under KRS 180.020 to 180.250 unless:
A road, suitable for heavy travel during all seasons of the year, is in existence, connecting the approaches of the bridge, or the Kentucky approach of an interstate bridge, with roads forming a part of the state primary road system; or
Sufficient funds have been appropriated and allocated for the construction of such a road.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 4356s-21.
